intro: Homalanthus nutans, commonly known as the spreading horsebean, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
